title: Berkeley BCSP Ferriss Fellowship
description: Reporting grants supporting in-depth print and audio journalism on the science, policy, business, and culture of psychedelics. A project of the UC Berkeley Center for the Science of Psychedelics.
eligibility: Open to journalists of all nationalities and backgrounds. No residency requirement.

title: Nieman Fellowships
description: In 1938, nine American journalists — “newspapermen,” in the parlance of the day — set foot on Harvard’s leafy campus to take part in a bold new experiment. They were the first Nieman Fellows, “persons deemed specially qualified for journalism” who, according to thebequest that created the Nieman Foundation, would help fulfill our mission to “promote and elevate the standards of journalism” through a year of study at one of the world’s great institutions of higher learning. Since that inaugura...
eligibility: Mid-career journalists (5+ years experience). Strong preference for working journalists. Must relocate to Cambridge, MA.

title: Grants Available for Investigations
description: (Washington)  The Fund for Investigative Journalism is currently accepting grant proposals to investigate stories in the United States and abroad. The Fund supports work done in all media. The deadline for applications is Monday, September 8 at 5pm Eastern Time.

title: Matthew Power Literary Reporting Award
description: Matthew Power (Photo: Amber Hunt) Matthew Power was an award-winning journalist who reported empathetically onthe human condition. He died in March 2014, while on assignment in Uganda. To learn about Power’s body of work, visithis website.
eligibility: Freelance writers working on narrative nonfiction. Project must be in progress but not yet completed.

title: Knight-Wallace Fellowships
description: Eight-month residential fellowship at University of Michigan for study, reflection, and collaboration. Fellows design their own course of study across all university departments.
eligibility: Mid-career journalists (5+ years experience) from any medium. Must be able to relocate to Ann Arbor.

title: Travel grant for event on public interest reporting and AI practices
Columbia Journalism Fellowships
description: Multiple fellowship programs including Knight-Bagehot (business/economics journalism), Stabile Center (investigative), and international programs. Varies by specific fellowship.
eligibility: Varies by program. Generally requires professional journalism experience.

title: The Fulcrum's 2026 Summer Journalism Fellowship | Solutions Journalism Network
description: The Fulcrum is taking applications for its 2026 Summer Journalism Fellowship. The 10‑week summer program is designed to train the next generation of journalists in solutions‑focused reporting and narrative complexity. The fellowship will run from June 8 through August 14, 2026. Apply by February 27, 2026.

title: USC Annenberg Fellowships
description: Various fellowship programs focusing on health journalism, specialized reporting, and professional development at USC in Los Angeles.
